comments.body: We should rename this since it isn't actually ctags structure (although ctags generation would still be a nice separate feature).
Not a blocker for the pr though.
Agree, we can rename ctags to something else. Suggestion are welcome

I'm guessing this is safe for now but I worry this pattern will become dangerous in the future if the first task is mutating compiler globals and the second independent task is also working inside compiler.  I fear concurrency and mutation together in general though.
The indexDependencyClasspath should be moved out of Compiler.scala since it doesn't do anything related to the compiler. Opened https://github.com/scalameta/language-server/issues/48
Is there any value in taking smaller locks during each individual indexDatabase call to give others time to jump in the gaps if it takes a long time to load indexes?
There is, I've opened https://github.com/scalameta/language-server/issues/49 to track improvements on this.
